Welcome to geometry2020’s documentation!¶

main.cartesian_representation_line(vec_1: numpy.array, vec_2: numpy.array, type: int = 1) → None[source]¶

This function print the cartesian presentation of a line a: numpy-array of the b: numpy-array of the

Parameters

  • vec_1 – first point

  • vec_2 – direction (type = 0) or the second point (type = 1)

  • type – it switches between two points and one point and a direction

main.conic_section_classification(coeff: list) → None[source]¶

This function provides a classification of a conic section

Parameters

coeff – list of the coefficient of the equation of the conic section

if the equation is

A x^2 + B xy + C y^2 + D x + E y + F = 0

then the array coeff is

[A,B,C,D,E,F]

main.gauss_elimination(matrix) → numpy.array[source]¶

This function compute Gauss elimination process :param matrix: generic matrix :return: matrix after the Gauss elimination

main.linear_dependence(matrix: numpy.array) → int[source]¶

This function answer to the question “Are these vectors linearly independent?”

Parameters

matrix – matrix with vectors as rows

Returns

the number of linearly independent vectors

main.linear_equations(matrix, vector) → numpy.array[source]¶

this function resolve a system of linear equations :param matrix: matrix of coefficients :param vector: vector of constant terms

>>> linear_equations(np.eye(2),np.array([1,1]))
The system has a single unique solution.
[1. 1.]

>>> linear_equations(np.array([[1,0],[1,0]]),np.array([1,0]))
The system has no solution.
